title: Meeting Culture Metastasis
context: Organizations use meetings to ensure alignment, make decisions, and share information. As the company grows, meetings multiply. Each meeting spawns pre-meetings, follow-up meetings, and status update meetings. Calendars fill until there's no time left for the work being discussed in the meetings. The average knowledge worker now spends 60-70% of their time in meetings, leaving 2-3 hours of fragmented time for actual productive work.
hypothesis: Meetings ensure alignment and improve organizational decision-making.

chain.root: Default to meetings for coordination and decisions

effects.label: Meeting count grows faster than headcount

children.label: Each new hire creates N new meeting connections — growth is quadratic
Meetings spawn meetings — pre-meetings, follow-ups, status syncs
Nobody cancels meetings — they only add new ones
Complex problems require 2-4 hour focus blocks that don't exist
Engineers and designers do real work before 9am, after 5pm, or on weekends
Context switching between meetings destroys cognitive performance

effects.label: Most meetings are unnecessary for most attendees
effects.impact: 71% of meetings rated unproductive by attendees

children.label: People attend defensively — fear of missing information or being seen as disengaged
Meetings used for information sharing that could be an email or document
Decision meetings where the decision was already made — theater

effects.label: Organizational velocity decreases despite feeling busy
effects.impact: Output per employee declining while hours worked increase

children.label: Teams confuse activity (meetings) with progress (shipped work)
Burnout increases — long days with nothing to show for them

dontIf: Your team's primary work requires deep focus and concentration
You're adding meetings to solve problems caused by too many meetings
ifYouMust: Institute no-meeting days (at least 2 per week) and enforce them ruthlessly
Default to 25-minute meetings, not 60 — Parkinson's law applies
Require a written agenda and desired outcome for every meeting — no agenda, no meeting
Audit meeting load quarterly — kill any recurring meeting that can't justify its existence

alternatives.name: Async-first communication
alternatives.note: Written updates, Loom videos, and documents replace 80% of status meetings

alternatives.name: Office hours model
alternatives.note: Leaders hold open office hours instead of scheduling 1:1s with everyone

alternatives.name: Decision documents
alternatives.note: Write proposals, collect async feedback, meet only if there's genuine disagreement
